titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Rice University Historic Clothing collection, 1916-2017 UA 392

publicationstmt.publisher: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

note.p: Boxes 2 and 5 stored onsite at the Woodson Research Center. Boxes 1, 3, 4, and 6-63 stored off-site at the Library Service Center. Please request this material via woodson@rice.edu or call 713-348-2586.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-04-02 13:40:02 -0500.

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.corpname: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

did.abstract: This collection contains costumes worn at Archi-Arts Ball, Freshmen beanies, Rice cheerleading uniforms, athletic sweaters, uniforms, club and program t-shirts, from various campus-wide events.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Rice University was founded in 1891 and opened in 1912. The clothing in this collection reflects many of the events and trends over the years from the Academic regalia of the first female graduate, Miss H. Lel Red in 1916, freshman beanies, cheerleading uniforms, costumes for the Archi-Arts ball to more recent t-shirts for campus-wide events and programs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains costumes worn at Archi-Arts Ball, Freshmen beanies, Rice cheerleading uniforms, athletic sweaters, uniforms, club and program t-shirts, from various campus-wide events.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This material is open for research. Boxes 2 and 5 stored onsite at the Woodson Research Center. Boxes 1, 3, 4, and 6-63 stored off-site at the Library Service Center. Please request this material via woodson@rice.edu or call 713-348-2586.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Clothing for this collection was taken both from the Association of Rice Alumni Collection (UA003) and the Rice University Memorabilia Collection (UA225)

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Rice University Historic Clothing Collection, 1916-2017, UA 392, Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the Rice Historic Clothing Collection must be obtained from the Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library.
